newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: One dead, five injured in Portugal school blast.
newsitem.headline: One dead, five injured in Portugal school blast.

text.p: A woman was killed and five people were injured in an explosion on Friday at a Portuguese school which local officials said appeared to have been caused by a bomb.
There were no children amongst the victims of the blast which occured at around 0815 GMT at a primary school in Fundao in central Portugal, 200 km (125 miles) northeast of Lisbon.
Fundao town councillor Jose Soares told local TSF radio that the explosion, which did extensive damage to the ground floor of the school, had been caused by an "explosive device."
Police in Fundao could not immediately confirm that a bomb had caused the explosion but bomb squad officials were at the scene.
The dead woman, named as Ana Maria Nunes, 32, and the five people injured in the explosion all worked in the school, police said.
Three of the injured were in serious condition and were being treated in nearby hospitals. The other two people suffered only slight injuries.
